title: A Multidimensional Perspective on COPD: How Coping Styles and Self-Esteem Relate to Psychological Distress and Functional Capacity.
abstract: Emerging evidence indicates that psychological resources may influence clinical outcomes and disease burden in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), but their interactions are still not well understood. This study examined how coping strategies and self-esteem are connected to psychological distress, symptom impact, and functional capacity in moderate and severe COPD.
journal: International journal of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
